name: EEB C119B C219B
body:
#Welcome to my TA page for EEB C119B/C219B
Our discussion meets from 11-12 in TLSB 4000. Note that this time and locations differs from the official registrar listing.  

My office hours are from 12-1 immediately following discussion. You can also schedule an appointment by email (kgostic@ucla.edu)

##Week 1
###R Resources
* [Install R](http://cran.us.r-project.org/) 
* [Install R Studio](https://www.rstudio.com/). R Studio is a free GUI (Graphical User Interface) for the R language that keeps things organized on your screen. You can run R without R Studio, but it’s a bit messy.
- If you are new to R and/or programming, read through [A Beginner’s Guide to R](http://link.springer.com/book/10.1007/978-0-387-93837-0), Ch 1. After reading this chapter, you should be able to:
  - Understand what a package is
  - Install packages
  - Load packages
  - Understand what your working directory is
  - Change your working directory
- For resources that will help you learn to program in R, try:
  - Sections 1-4 and 6 of [Try R code school](http://tryr.codeschool.com/)
  - Chapters 1-6 of [A Beginner’s Guide to R](http://link.springer.com/book/10.1007/978-0-387-93837-0)
- For an introduction to ecological analyses, with supporting R code instructions, try:
  * [A Primer of Ecology with R](http://link.springer.com/book/10.1007/978-0-387-89882-7)
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
